title: As a League Economics Admin, I want to remove a player from the Pre-Arb Bonus Pool Utility
custom_preconds:
Wire: [https://30ac5x.axshare.com/#p=pre_arb_bonus_pool&g=1|https://30ac5x.axshare.com/#p=pre_arb_bonus_pool&g=1]

GIVEN user is a League Economics Admin
custom_steps: WHEN on the Pre-Arb Bonus Pool Utility
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a trash can icon on each row in view mode
AND clicking the trash can icon will remove the row
AND the changes will not be committed unless the user clicks save
BUT if the user attempts to navigate away without saving
THEN they will be notified of unsaved changes

title: As a BOC Admin User, I want to save a previously saved Player Memo Template
custom_preconds: Player Memo Editor user is viewing a saved Player Memo Template
custom_steps: WHEN opening a previously saved Player Memo Template
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a "Save" button on the form
AND if user clicks Save, any changes will be comitted w/o sending the Player Memo to the users
AND when the Save is compelte, a blue save successful notification banner will be displayed
AND user will be returned to the Player Memo Template widget
AND the edits will be reflected when the template is opened again

title: As a BOC Admin, I want to delete a saved player memo template
custom_steps: WHEN Player Memo Editor is viewing a Player Memo Template
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a trash can icon on the Player Memo Templates widget, as depicated
AND clicking the trash can icon will prompt the user to confirm their action
AND if the user clicks Cancel, the warning will be dismissed and nothing will happen
AND if the user clicks Delete:
-- the Template will be deleted from the system
-- the warning will be dismissed
-- there will be a blue deleted messaged displayed

title: As a BOC User, I want to open a saved player memo template
custom_steps: WHEN a Player Memo Editor user views the Player Memo Template widget
custom_expected:
THEN saved player memo templates will be displaye din the Player Memo Templates widget
AND the subject line will appear as a hyperlink
AND clicking the hyperlink will load the template
AND four additional fields will be displayed on a saved template:
-- created
-- created by
-- Last Saved
-- Saved by
AND there will be a Send and Save button on the template
AND clicking the button will prompt the user to confirm their action
-- IF user confirms
--- The memo will be sent
  --- The memo will be displayed in the history widget
  --- Any updates made will be saved to the template
AND if User does not confirm, they will be returned to the template
AND users will also be able to save the template without sending

title: As a BOC Admin, I want to save an player memo as a template
custom_steps: WHEN user with EDIT perms clicks "New Memo" button
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a "Save as Template" button on the Player Memo screen
AND there will be a "Template Title" field on the memo
AND when the "Save as Template" button is selected, the user will be returned to the Player Memo Template widget
AND the saved player memo will be listed as template in the widget
AND a successful Saved banner will display

title: As a BOC Admin, I want ebis to automatically return a player from rehab if they are traded
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is a BOC Admin
custom_steps:
WHEN a player is on a rehab assignment 
AND that player is included as part of an outright trade
custom_expected:
THEN EBIS will automatically create a return from rehab transaction
AND when the trade is complete
THEN the player will be part of the new org but will remain on the IL
THEN the player's new org will create a new place on rehab assignment if they wish

title: As a BOC Admin, I want to see a Player Memo History widget
custom_expected:
THEN On the Player Memos tab, there will be a History widget
AND The widget will match the provided wire and data discovery

title: As a BOC Admin, I want to see a Player Memo Templates widget
custom_steps: WHEN viewing the Player Memo tab
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a Email Templates widget
AND The widget will match the provided wire and data discovery
AND The Templates widget will appear below the History widget

Note: not currently in the Player Memo wires, using the Email Blast wires as it is the same functionality

title: MLS on Arb Utility not updating in certain scenarios
custom_preconds:
While testing https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-430 i discovered the following:
1)this is not working when I trade a player to a new org and then approve a report date a few days later:
I traded this player from WSH to CLE with the following setup:
https://ebisdev.mlb.com/ebisui/#/pro-player-profile/service?playerId=327959

Trade to become NYR:4/1
Report date: 4/17
4/1-4/17: 15(27.9)
Season Days today:45(83.7)
Days left in season:40(74.4)
Season Days EOS: 85(158.1)
MLS today: 4.147
Projected EOS-MLS: 5.048
After the trade, his projected EOS MLS is correct on the salary arb report, but his MLS on the Arb utility did not re-calc. He moved to the new org on the utility correctly but his MLS still shows the previous value of 5.063

2)the same thing is happening if I option a guy then recall him >30 days later (to avoid giveback). I setup Nomar Mazara with the following:
https://ebisdev.mlb.com/ebisui/#/pro-player-profile/service?playerId=369813
Option: 03/05
Recall: 4/10
3/5-4/10: 35(65.1)
Season Days today: 25(46.5)
Days left in season:40(74.4)
Season Days EOS: 65(120.9)
MLS today: 4.046
Projected EOS-MLS: 4.120
After the recall, his MLS is correct on the report but on the arb utility he still shows the previous projected MLS of 5.000

There were some outstanding questions related to MLS projections on the Arb Utility when it's finalized vs when it's not yet finalized.See:
https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/EBISII-18353
https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/EBISII-18342

So we should use this JIRA to determine how we want MLS projections to work on the Arb Utility 

(note: the calculation for MLS is correct for these players, it's just not flowing through to the utility for the scenarios listed above)

title: As a League Economics User, I want to upload players to the Pre-Arb Bonus Pool utility via spreadsheet
custom_preconds:
Wire:

* [https://30ac5x.axshare.com/#p=import_players&g=1|https://30ac5x.axshare.com/#p=import_players&g=1]
* [https://30ac5x.axshare.com/#p=import_error_if_players_exist&g=1|https://30ac5x.axshare.com/#p=import_error_if_players_exist&g=1]

GIVEN a user is a League Economics user
custom_steps: WHEN players are to be uploaded to the Pre-Arb Bonus Pool Utility
custom_expected:
THEN there will be an import players button on the utility
AND clicking the button will open a modal where the user can browse for file to upload and for what year
AND the modal will also have a template that can be downloaded [only three columns are needed: PlayerID, WAR, and Amount]
AND there will be an Import and Cancel button on the modal
AND the Cancel button will dismiss the modal
THEN once a file has been selected, the import file button will become active in the modal
AND clicking on the button will import players into the utility
AND if there are any players that fail on import, they will be returned in a spreadsheet, attached to a modal as depicted
AND uploading the spreadsheet multiple times in a year will overwrite the previous upload [Will return a warning message: *This action will overwrite what has already been entered*]

title: As an Intl Admin, I want Origins to reflect IPL Invitations
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is an Intl Admin
custom_steps: WHEN viewing the Reg Admin Widget
custom_expected:
THEN the Org under 'Registered By' and 'Also Registered By' will reflect the Orgs who sent the invitations to the players
AND The first org to invite a player will appear under 'Registered By'
THEN any Org issuing subsequent invitations will appear under 'Also Registered By'
AND if the BOC invites a player
THEN BOC will appear as the Origin
AND Players who register through the Self Registration process will also appear as BOC origin

title: As MJC User, I want to see Pre-Arb Bonus Pool Data on Pro Player Profiles
custom_preconds:
Wire: [https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=contracts&g=1|https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=contracts&g=1]

GIVEN a user is an MJC User
custom_steps: WHEN viewing the Pre-Arb Bonus Pool Widget
custom_expected:
THEN The Pre-Arb Bonus Pool widget will be populated with data entered into the Pre-Arb Bonus Pool Utility
AND the data will match the values and formatting of the utility
AND the widget will only display data that pertains to the appropriate player

title: As a MJC User, I want to view a Pre-Arb Bonus Pool widget on Pro Player Profiles
custom_preconds:
Wire: [https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=contracts&g=1|https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=contracts&g=1]

GIVEN a user is an MJC User
custom_steps: WHEN on the Contracts tab of pro players profiles
custom_expected:
THEN users with MJC permission will see a Pre-Arb Bonus Pool widget on the Contracts tab of pro players profiles
AND the widget will match the provided wire
AND the widget will be sorted descending by year
AND the widget will appear below the contract history and above MN Bonus Payments
AND the widget should only appear when a player has entries and should not appear blank for anyone

title: As a League Economics Admin, I want to add a player to the Pre-Arb Bonus Pool utility
custom_preconds:
Wire: [https://30ac5x.axshare.com/#p=pre_arb_bonus_pool&g=1|https://30ac5x.axshare.com/#p=pre_arb_bonus_pool&g=1]

GIVEN a user is a League Economics Admin
custom_steps: WHEN a user is on the Pre-Arb Bonus Pool Utility
custom_expected:
THEN this utility should follow the standard editable table functionality
AND there will be an Add Row in the footer of the widget
AND clicking Add Row will add a new blank row in edit mode and scroll the widget to that row
AND there will be a Save button that will work as expected to commit changes
AND there will be a Cancel button that will work as expected to revert changes and return to view mode
AND there will be an Edit button that will put all rows into edit mode [only Player, WAR, and Amount will be editable and the Player Column will be an autocomplete that uses the same population as Active MJC Quick Search]

title: As a League Economics User, I want to see a Pre-Arb Bonus Pool utility on the Awards Entry Screen
custom_preconds:
Wire:

* [https://30ac5x.axshare.com/#p=pre_arb_bonus_pool&g=1|https://30ac5x.axshare.com/#p=pre_arb_bonus_pool&g=1]

GIVEN a user is a League Economics user
custom_steps: WHEN on the MJ Contracts Dashboard
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a new Pre-Arb Bonus Pool utility in a new tab on the MJ Contract Dashboard
AND this utility will appear on its own tab similar to the Award Entry utility
AND the form will have a header filter for Year [The Year default will update to the current year on Opening Day each year]
AND the list will have four columns: Player(Last, Roster First), Org(EOS Org), WAR, Amount(Primary Sort - Descending)
AND this new utility will be tied to the MJC Awards permissions, both viewer and editor

title: As a developer I want to use the new projected EOS MLS values to simplify the salary arbitration eligible calculation
custom_preconds:
Using the new projected EOS MLS values, we should generate the list of arb eligible players whenever a transaction is entered which impacts arb eligible status.

Currently, the process attempts to figure out all possible players using a complicated query to find super twos and anyone who is arb eligible.  Now that we have EOS MLS, we can simply use that to check:
1.  if the current player is going to be arb eligible with EOS MLS greater than or equal to 3 and less than 6
OR
2.  if the player's MLS impacts the super two list, thus changing that player as well as possibly another player

in the first case: 
When the player is now an arb eligible but wasn't before then they will have an arb eligible record created for them with MLS listed as their EOS MLS
When the player was an arb eligible but now is not their arb eligible record will be marked deleted
When the player is an existing arb eligible and still is an existing arb eligible - their EOS MLS will be updated and nothing else

In the second case: 
If the player is now a super 2 and was not before then they will have an arb eligible record created for them with MLS listed as their EOS MLS and additionally the entire arb eligible population of super 2s will be checked to see if anyone should be removed due to this player supplanting them.
If the player was a super 2 and is now not, their arb eligible record will be deleted and the entire super 2 list will be checked to see if any players need to be ADDED to the list
If the player was a super 2 before and is now then their EOS MLS will be updated and nothing else needs to happen

custom_preconds:
Please remove the three following Forms from the Reporting menu in ebis:
 - Employee Permission Form - Contracted
 - Employee Permission Form - Non Contract
 - Employee Permission Form - Non-Contracted

Please add the the attached "Employee Permission Form" under the Blank Letters label

title: As an Intl Admin, I want Registered By and Last Updated usernames accurately displayed in ebis
custom_preconds:
Related to https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/EBISII-20367

GIVEN a user is an Intl Admin
custom_steps: WHEN a player is registered or updated in IPL as a BOC User
custom_expected:
THEN their full username will continue to be displayed, regardless of what system the update is made
BUT IF the player registers or makes updates to their profile in IPL
THEN EBIS will display 'Player' and the username
AND 'Last Updated' should only reflect updates to reviews, general profile updates are not reflected
